alert.note: Alert for Cotton (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 10:24PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cotton, northwestern Clay and southeastern Wichita Counties through 1100 PM CST... At 1022 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Iowa Park, moving east at 35 mph. This storm will likely produce excessive amounts of small hail, enough to cover the ground. This could pose a hazard on roadways on the west and northern portions of Wichita Falls. HAZARD...Dime to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Iowa Park, Dean, Sheppard AFB, Pleasant Valley and Cashion. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
